Sparks Grove × Delta Air Lines

Reimagining Delta's Digital Storytelling

I led the design team that transformed how the world's most-traveled airline communicates with 90,000 employees and millions of customers.

The Challenge

A global airline needed a communications platform worthy of its brand.

Delta's internal and external storytelling lived across fragmented, dated systems that didn't reflect the premium experience the airline had built in the air. I directed the design vision for the Delta News Hub — a unified communications platform that would serve corporate comms, media relations, and employee engagement under one cohesive experience.

My Role

UX Design Practice Leader

Agency

Sparks Grove

Scope

Web Platform, Content Strategy, Responsive Design

Team

UX Designers, Visual Designers, Content Strategists, Engineering

The Work

Delta News Hub

We designed a content-rich platform that balances editorial storytelling with real-time operational information — giving Delta a digital newsroom that felt as polished as their in-flight experience.

Homepage — Full Editorial System

Category-driven content architecture with featured stories, operational updates, and deep-dive sections.

Navigation & Information Architecture

Clean content hierarchy organized by audience and topic.

Responsive & Mobile Experience

Adaptive layouts that maintained editorial quality across every device.

Beyond Digital

The work extended into brand moments that mattered.

Our relationship with Delta went deeper than screens. The design language we established informed brand experiences across the organization — from centennial celebrations to employee engagement campaigns. When you lead design for a brand this iconic, every touchpoint has to earn its place.
